intro: Monotoca baileyana, commonly known as the Bailey's sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky areas. Its flowers are usually pale blue or violet, and it blooms during the spring and early summer. Monotoca baileyana is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
